programmes.show_description: Trapped In My Legs. Samantha's severe lymphedema has left her legs swollen, scaly, and painful and she is barely able to walk. Dr. Emma steps in with intensive treatment. S8, Ep7
Plum Nose. Brittney has hundreds of tiny bumps over her chest that have destroyed her confidence. John has a nose the size of a plum. Dr. Lee's friend drops in. S5, Ep6
Pig Snout. Mike's religious beliefs have kept him from seeing a doctor about his huge growth. Plus, Kylie debates whether to remove her birthmark. S5, Ep7
Juan's Journey. Pastor Juan's love of food made him overweight, but it was never a problem until he got too big to preach and sing to his congregation. S10, Ep20
Hollywood Meets Bollywood. Bride Stephanie tries to please her squabbling parents. Plus, a former pageant queen wants a dress with a Hollywood-meets-Bollywood vibe. S18, Ep6
This Is A Randy Situation. Indecisive bride Jacqueline has a challenge for Randy. Plus, a hip-hop medium is on the hunt for the perfect black dress for her special day. S18, Ep7
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Mike Check. When Molly learns it's been more than ten years since her husband's seen a doctor, she badgers a reluctant Mike to get checked out. S5, Ep8
Hack To The Future. Molly runs into a roadblock in the form of her publisher, who wants her to make a provocative rewrite in a section of her book. S5, Ep9
Checkpoint Joyce. When Joyce refuses to take a breathalyser test at a DUI checkpoint, Mike is forced to arrest her. S5, Ep10
A Suitcase Full Of Cash. When Meemaw's gambling room is a success, she ends up with a suitcase of illegal cash. Missy starts a business, and Sheldon tries the stock market. S5, Ep16
Solo Peanut, Social Butterfly. Sheldon gets an odd request from an old friend, while George and Mary are caught in the middle of Meemaw and Dale's breakup. S5, Ep17
Babies, Lies And A Cannoli. While Sheldon copes with the death of a hero, Georgie struggles with his big secret, and Missy wants to babysit. S5, Ep18
The Meteorite Manifestation. Sheldon helps Bernadette and Howard navigate bureaucratic paperwork. Leonard is disappointed when his friends exclude him from a scientific project. S12, Ep14
The Donation Oscillation. Penny tries to seduce an abstaining Leonard to ruin his 'donation' for her ex-boyfriend and his wife. Raj's cancelled bachelor party takes a turn. S12, Ep15
The D & D Vortex. The gang finds out Wil Wheaton hosts a celebrity Dungeons and Dragons game. Deception and betrayal are the path to make it to the one open seat. S12, Ep16
The Conference Valuation. While Bernadette is away and Howard is in charge of the kids, Sheldon finds a book on experimenting on kids. The guys plus Amy make a day of it. S12, Ep17
The Laureate Accumulation. Pemberton and Campbell charm America, so Sheldon and Amy bring Nobel laureates Kip Thorne, George Smoot and Frances Arnold to their side. S12, Ep18
The Inspiration Deprivation. Amy has a meltdown due to the pressure associated with winning a Nobel Prize. Raj and Howard try to relive the good old days. S12, Ep19
The Decision Reverberation. Raj is worried people won't take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. S12, Ep20
The Plagiarism Schism. Kripke has proof that Dr. Pemberton plagiarized his thesis, and Sheldon and Amy aren't sure whether they should turn him in or not. S12, Ep21
Immaculate Deception. The prospect of an empty house for the weekend has Mike and Molly in a state of excitement. S5, Ep11
The World According To Peggy. When Peggy suddenly announces she's leaving her job, Molly scrambles to throw her a retirement party, but wonders just why Peggy is calling it quits. S5, Ep12
Buy The Book. It's an exciting new chapter in Molly's life as her book is finally released, but she soon becomes obsessively worried that no one will buy it. S5, Ep13
A God-Fearin' Baptist. George and Mary insist on meeting the new woman in Georgie's life, while Sheldon and Missy have suspicions about what's going on with their family. S5, Ep19
Uncle Sheldon. Despite the whole family trying to keep it a secret, Sheldon and Missy learn about Georgie's pregnancy. S5, Ep20
White Trash, Holy Rollers. With the Coopers facing judgement from the congregation in the wake of Georgie's pregnancy, Sheldon is distracted by the family drama. S5, Ep21
The Maternal Conclusion. Leonard is surprised when Beverly is kind to him on a visit, until he finds out the real reason she's there. Denise and Stuart overstay their welcome. S12, Ep22
The Change Constant. Everything changes as Amy and Sheldon await big news. Howard and Bernadette leave their kids, while Leonard and Penny keep a secret. S12, Ep23
The Stockholm Syndrome. Bernadette and Howard leave their kids, Penny and Leonard try to keep a secret, Sheldon and Amy stick together, and Raj makes a new friend. S12, Ep24
Pilot. Brilliant physicists Leonard and Sheldon meet new neighbour Penny, who shows them that although they're smart, they know very little about real life. S1, Ep1
The Big Bran Hypothesis. Leonard volunteers to sign for a package to make a good impression on Penny, but things go terribly awry when he enlists Sheldon for help. S1, Ep2
The Fuzzy Boots Corollary. Leonard is depressed to learn that Penny is dating someone. Encouraged by his friends and fellow scientists, he asks a colleague out on a date. S1, Ep3
The Luminous Fish Effect. Sheldon gets fired and explores what life has to offer outside physics, leaving Leonard to take drastic action to snap his friend out of his funk. S1, Ep4
The Hamburger Postulate. Fearing he's wasting his time on Penny, Leonard makes a connection with Leslie. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. S1, Ep5
Brace For Impact. Lisa struggles with Daniel's cultural expectations, Forrest meets Sheena's family, and Rick and Trish clash over financial expectations. S8, Ep7
Working For The Enemy. Audrey's past rears its head when Georgie leaves the tire store to work for Fred Fagenbacher, Jim's longtime nemesis. S1, Ep11
Typhoid Georgie. Georgie worries he's letting his family down when he's forced to stay home ill, and Mandy worries about how her career will affect her marriage. S1, Ep12
Amputation Deliberation. Tyler's hands are so cracked and painful that he considers getting them amputated. And Ebonee covers the tiny bumps around her eyes with sunglasses. S5, Ep8
Zombie Skin. Erica stabbed her hand with a pencil 45 years ago and believes the lead remains trapped in her palm. Paula's swollen feet emit a foul odour. S5, Ep9
Jonathan's Journey. Once an EMT first responder, Jonathan now rarely leaves the room. He must break the cycle of eating if he wants to keep his wife and his life. S10, Ep21
Whose Side Are You On? Michaella is getting married in an Irish castle and wants a princess dress for her big day. And, fashionista Shavonne has a high-style reputation to maintain. S18, Ep8
She Popped The Thigh At Me. Bride Samantha has mastered her weight-loss goals, but can she get her mum to like her wedding dress? Plus, a bride has a glam wedding in Puerto Rico. S18, Ep9
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
Introduction To Engineering. Sheldon takes his first engineering class with Professor Boucher. Meanwhile, Meemaw and Dale help take care of his ex-wife, June. S5, Ep7
The Grand Chancellor. While Sheldon battles the mysterious Grand Chancellor of the university over science requirements, Mary makes a shocking discovery about Georgie. S5, Ep8
The Yips And Hypnotic Bohemian. While George Sr. plays handyman at Brenda Sparks' house, Sheldon gets the science yips and has to learn how not to think. S5, Ep9
An Expensive Glitch. Sheldon gets a dorm room all to himself, which soon becomes the campus hotspot. Meanwhile, Meemaw gets an unwanted business partner. S5, Ep10
A Lock-In, A Weather Girl. Sheldon acts as Mary's spy when he's forced to spend the night at church for a youth lock-in. Meanwhile, Georgie gets attracted to an older woman. S5, Ep11
A Pink Cadillac. Sheldon attends his first comic book convention, and Mary tries selling makeup. S5, Ep12
Working For The Enemy. Audrey's past rears its head when Georgie leaves the tire store to work for Fred Fagenbacher, Jim's longtime nemesis. S1, Ep11
Typhoid Georgie. Georgie worries he's letting his family down when he's forced to stay home ill, and Mandy worries about how her career will affect her marriage. S1, Ep12
The Separation Triangulation. Raj learns the woman he's dating has a very upset husband. Sheldon rents his old room for a quiet place to work. S11, Ep14
The Novelization Correlation. Wil Wheaton offers Amy a role on the new 'Professor Proton Show,' and Penny thinks the female protagonist in Leonard's novel is based on her. S11, Ep15
The Neonatal Nomenclature. All Bernadette's friends try different tactics to get labour started. Amy accidentally reveals she's already chosen their son's name. S11, Ep16
The Athenaeum Allocation. Leonard tries to secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy. Bernadette and Howard have a hard time deciding who should go back to work. S11, Ep17
The Gates Excitation. Bill Gates' company wants to partner with Penny's pharmaceutical company. Leonard, Raj and Howard do everything in their power to meet him. S11, Ep18
The Tenant Disassociation. Leonard decides to run against Sheldon for president of the tenants' association. Bernadette encourages Howard and Raj to find the owner of a drone. S11, Ep19
The Reclusive Potential. A reclusive scientist invites Sheldon to his remote cabin. Penny and Bernadette improvise after Amy doesn't like the bachelorette they planned. S11, Ep20
The Comet Polarization. Sheldon's comic book store experience changes when Neil Gaiman puts Stuart's store on the map. And Raj takes credit for Penny's astronomical discovery. S11, Ep21
The Monetary Insufficiency. Sheldon goes to Vegas to win money for science. Penny and Bernadette take Amy wedding dress shopping, but her choice entangles them in a web of lies. S11, Ep22
The Sibling Realignment. Sheldon and Leonard travel to Texas to end a family feud. The Wolowitz kids inadvertently infest Amy, Bernadette, Howard and Raj with pinkeye. S11, Ep23
The Bow Tie Asymmetry. When Amy's parents and Sheldon's family arrive, everybody is focused on making sure all goes according to plan - everyone except the bride and groom. S11, Ep24
The Conjugal Configuration. Sheldon and Amy's honeymoon runs aground, while Penny and Leonard discover similarities with Amy's parents. Raj insults physicist Neil deGrasse Tyson. S12, Ep1
The Wedding Gift Wormhole. Sheldon and Amy try to figure out what 'perfect gift' Leonard and Penny gave them. Raj asks his father to arrange a marriage for him. S12, Ep2
The Procreation Calculation. Stuart starts bringing his new girlfriend home, Penny and Leonard talk about starting a family, and Raj explores an arranged marriage. S12, Ep3
The Tam Turbulence. Sheldon won't tell anyone why he's never mentioned his childhood friend Tam. Bernadette and Penny take out Raj's fiancée to get the skinny on her. S12, Ep4
The Planetarium Collision. Amy doesn't have time to work on a project, so Sheldon goes to great lengths to ensure she can work with him, even if it means sabotaging her career. S12, Ep5
The Imitation Perturbation. When Howard dresses up as Sheldon for Halloween, Sheldon seeks retaliation. Leonard is shocked that Penny doesn't remember their first kiss. S12, Ep6
Grant Allocation Derivation. Leonard is caught in a tough spot when he's responsible for distributing extra grant money. Bernadette turns the backyard playhouse into a hideaway. S12, Ep7
The Consummation Deviation. Sheldon tries to bond with Amy's father, but Howard lures Mr. Fowler away with magic tricks. Raj and Anu try to get physical for the first time. S12, Ep8
The Citation Negation. Sheldon and Amy are devastated learning that Super Asymmetry has been discovered and disproven. Bernadette asks Denise to help her win a videogame. S12, Ep9
When a mystery assassin starts killing the world's most beautiful people, former models Derek and Hansel must reclaim their fame and save the day.
